feed.title: 繁華落盡 似水流年 • Posts by "algorithm" tag

entry.title: 组合数
entry.content:
# 组合数求法

# 方法一 ：动态规划（取模值）

利用组合数公式：Cab=Ca−1b+Ca−1b−1C^{b}_{a} = C^{b}_{a - 1} + C^{b - 1}_{a - 1}Cab​=Ca−1b​+Ca−1b−1​ 进行状态转移.

  • 对于Cab=Ca−1b+Ca−1b−1C^{b}_{a} = C^{b}_{a - 1} + C^{b - 1}_{a - 1}Cab​=Ca−1b​+Ca−1b−1​ 的理解:

    CabC^{b}_{a}Cab​ 的数学含义：从有aaa 个小球的箱子中随机抽bbb 个小球的方案数.
    ⇔\Leftrightarrow⇔ 1. 先从箱子中选一个小球，那么还需要从a−1a-1a−1 个小球中选b−1b-1b−1 个小球，方案数为Ca−1b−1C^{b - 1}_{a - 1}Ca−1b−1​. 2. 先从箱子中选一个小球扔掉，那么还需要从a−1a-1a−1 个小球中选bbb 个小球，方案数为C^{b}_

求解CabC^{b}_{a}Cab​ 的值，结果对109−710^{9}-7109−7 取模.

  • 时间复杂度：O(n2)O(n^{2})O(n2)
  • 空间复杂度：O(n2)O(n^{2})O(n2)

运用场景：可以通过预处理求出CabC_{a}^{b}Cab​ 范围内的所有组合数，然后通过O(1)O(1)O(1) 时间复杂度求出该组合数.
局限性：当aaa 很大时，预处理的时间和空间的复杂度都无法接受

相关题目：

  • 885. 求组合数 I

# 方法二：费马小定理 + 快速幂（取模值）

利用组合数公式：C_{a}^{b}=\frac{a(a-1)\times (a-b+1)}{b!}= \frac{a(a - 1) \cdots (a-b+1) \times (a-b)!}{b!(a-b)!}=\frac{a!}

  1. 预处理出所以n!n!n!
  2. 利用费马小定理：Cab%MOD=a!b!(a−b)!%MOD=a!×{b!(a−b)!}−1C_{a}^{b} \% MOD=\frac{a!}{b!(a-b)!} \% MOD=a!\times\{b!(a-b)!\}^{-1}Cab​%MOD=b!(a−b)!a!​%MOD=a!×{b!(a−b)!}−1，其中{b!(a−b)!}−1\{b!(a-b)!\}^{-1}{b!(a−b)!}−1 指代b!(a−b)!b!(a-b)!b!(a−b)! 关于MODMODMOD 的逆元
  3. 通过快速幂求解逆元
  • 时间复杂度：预处理阶乘O(n)O(n)O(n)， 求解组合数O(logn)O(logn)O(logn)
  • 空间复杂度：存储阶乘数组O(n)O(n)O(n)

局限性：当aaa 超大时，预处理的时间和空间的复杂度都无法接受，例如a>10^

相关题目：

  • 886. 求组合数 II

# 方法三：Lucas（卢卡斯） 定理（取模值）

# 方法四：高精度（准确值）

entry.title: 算法日志
entry.content:
# 1759D - Make It Round

贝兰迪亚发生了通货膨胀，因此商店需要改变商品价格。

给出了商品 nnn 的当前价格。允许将商品价格提高 kkk 倍，其中 1≤k≤m1 \le k \le m1≤k≤m ，k 为整数。输出该商品最可能的新价格。也就是最后有最多零的价格。

例如，数字 481000 比数字 1000010 更圆 (481000 末尾有三个 0，而 1000010 末尾只有一个 0)。

如果有几种可能的变式，则输出新价格最大的变式。

如果不可能得到更圆的价格，则输出 n⋅mn \cdot mn⋅m (即最大可能价格)。

输入

第一行包含一个整数 ttt ( 1≤t≤1041 \le t \le 10^41≤t≤104 ) -- 测试中的测试用例数。

每个测试用例包含一行。

这一行包含两个整数： nnn 和 mmm ( 1≤n,m≤1091 \le n, m \le 10^91≤n,m≤109 )。其中， nnn 是商品的旧价格，而数字 mmm 表示商品价格 nnn 的增长不能超过 mmm 倍。

输出

针对每个测试用例，另起一行输出形式为 n⋅kn \cdot kn⋅k ( 1≤k≤m1 \le k \le m1≤k≤m,kkk - 整数)。

如果存在多个可能的变量，则输出新价格 (值 n⋅kn \cdot kn⋅k ) 最大的变量。

如果不可能得到更圆整的价格，则输出 n⋅mn \cdot mn⋅m (即最大可能价格)。

样例

Input
10
6 11
5 43
13 5
4 16
10050 12345
2 6
4 30
25 10
2 81
1 7
Output
60
200
65
60
120600000
10
100
200
100
7

Note

第一种情况是 n=6n = 6n=6 ， m=11m = 11m=11 。我们不能得到末尾有两个 0 或更多 0 的数字，因为我们需要把价格提高 505050 倍，而不是 50>m=1150 \gt m = 1150>m=11 。 101010 的最大价格倍数是 6⋅10=606 \cdot 10 = 606⋅10=60 。

第二种情况是 n=5n = 5n=5 ， m=43m = 43m=43 。 100100100 的最大价格倍数是 5⋅40=2005 \cdot 40 = 2005⋅40=200 。

第三种情况是 n=13n = 13n=13 、 m=5m = 5m=5 。所有可能的新价格都不会以 000 结尾，那么应该输出 n⋅m=65n \cdot m = 65n⋅m=65 。

在第四种情况下，应将价格提高 151515 倍。

在第五种情况下，应将价格提高 120001200012000 倍。

AC Code

# 991C - Candies

time limit per test: 1 second
memory limit per test: 256 megabytes
input: standard input
output: standard output

After passing a test, Vasya got himself a box of nnn candies. He decided to eat an equal amount of candies each morning until there are no more candies. However, Petya also noticed the box and decided to get some candies for himself.

This means the process of eating candies is the following: in the beginning Vasya chooses a single integer kkk, same for all days. After that, in the morning he eats kkk candies from the box (if there are less than kkk candies in the box, he eats them all), then in the evening Petya eats 10%10\%10% of the candies remaining in the box. If there are still candies left in the box, the process repeats — next day Vasya eats kkk candies again, and Petya — 10%10\%10% of the candies left in a box, and so on.

If the amount of candies in the box is not divisible by 101010, Petya rounds the amount he takes from the box down. For example, if there were 979797 candies in the box, Petya would eat only 999 of them. In particular, if there are less than 101010 candies in a box, Petya won't eat any at all.

Your task is to find out the minimal amount of kkk that can be chosen by Vasya so that he would eat at least half of the nnn candies he initially got. Note that the number kkk must be integer.

Input

The first line contains a single integer nnn (1≤n≤10181 \leq n \leq 10^{18}1≤n≤1018) — the initial amount of candies in the box.

Output

Output a single integer — the minimal amount of kkk that would allow Vasya to eat at least half of candies he got.

Example

Input
68
Output
3

Note

In the sample, the amount of candies, with k=3k=3k=3, would change in the following way (Vasya eats first):

68→65→59→56→51→48→44→41→37→34→31→28→26→23→21→18→17→14→13→10→9→6→6→3→3→068→65→59→56→51→48→44→41→37→34→31→28→26→23→21→18→17→14→13→10→9→6→6→3→3→0.

In total, Vasya would eat 393939 candies, while Petya — 292929.

AC Code

# 1714D - Color with Occurrences

You are given some text ttt and a set of nnn strings s1,s2,…,sns_1, s_2, \dots, s_ns1​,s2​,…,sn​.

In one step, you can choose any occurrence of any string sis_isi​ in the text ttt and color the corresponding characters of the text in red. For example, if t=bababat=\texttt{bababa}t=bababa and s1=bas_1=\texttt{ba}s1​=ba, s2=abas_2=\texttt{aba}s2​=aba, you can get t=bababat=\color{red}{\texttt{ba}}\texttt{baba}t=bababa, t=bababat=\texttt{b}\color{red}{\texttt{aba}}\texttt{ba}t=bababa or t=bababat=\texttt{bab}\color{red}{\texttt{aba}}t=bababa in one step.

You want to color all the letters of the text ttt in red. When you color a letter in red again, it stays red.

In the example above, three steps are enough:

  • Let's color t[2…4]=s2=abat[2 \dots 4]=s_2=\texttt{aba}t[2…4]=s2​=aba in red, we get t=bababat=\texttt{b}\color{red}{\texttt{aba}}\texttt{ba}t=bababa;
  • Let's color t[1…2]=s1=bat[1 \dots 2]=s_1=\texttt{ba}t[1…2]=s1​=ba in red, we get t=bababat=\color{red}{\texttt{baba}}\texttt{ba}t=bababa;
  • Let's color t[4…6]=s2=abat[4 \dots 6]=s_2=\texttt{aba}t[4…6]=s2​=aba in red, we get t=bababat=\color{red}{\texttt{bababa}}t=bababa.

Each string sis_isi​ can be applied any number of times (or not at all). Occurrences for coloring can intersect arbitrarily.

Determine the minimum number of steps needed to color all letters ttt in red and how to do it. If it is impossible to color all letters of the text ttt in red, output -1.

Input

The first line of the input contains an integer qqq (1≤q≤1001 \le q \le 1001≤q≤100) —the number of test cases in the test.

The descriptions of the test cases follow.

The first line of each test case contains the text ttt (1≤∣t∣≤1001 \le |t| \le 1001≤∣t∣≤100), consisting only of lowercase Latin letters, where ∣t∣|t|∣t∣ is the length of the text ttt.

The second line of each test case contains a single integer nnn (1≤n≤101 \le n \le 101≤n≤10) — the number of strings in the set.

This is followed by nnn lines, each containing a string sis_isi​ (1≤∣si∣≤101 \le |s_i| \le 101≤∣si​∣≤10) consisting only of lowercase Latin letters, where ∣si∣|s_i|∣si​∣ — the length of string sis_isi​.

Output

For each test case, print the answer on a separate line.

If it is impossible to color all the letters of the text in red, print a single line containing the number -1.

Otherwise, on the first line, print the number mmm — the minimum number of steps it will take to turn all the letters ttt red.

Then in the next mmm lines print pairs of indices: wjw_jwj​ and pjp_jpj​ (1≤j≤m1 \le j \le m1≤j≤m), which denote that the string with index wjw_jwj​ was used as a substring to cover the occurrences starting in the text ttt from position pjp_jpj​. The pairs can be output in any order.

If there are several answers, output any of them.

Example

Input
6
bababa
2
ba
aba
caba
2
bac
acab
abacabaca
3
aba
bac
aca
baca
3
a
c
b
codeforces
4
def
code
efo
forces
aaaabbbbcccceeee
4
eeee
cccc
aaaa
bbbb
Output
3
2 2
1 1
2 4
-1
4
1 1
2 6
3 3
3 7
4
3 1
1 2
2 3
1 4
2
4 5
2 1
4
3 1
4 5
2 9
1 13

Note

The first test case is explained in the problem statement.

In the second test case, it is impossible to color all the letters of the text in red.

AC Code

# 938D - Buy a Ticket

Musicians of a popular band "Flayer" have announced that they are going to "make their exit" with a world tour. Of course, they will visit Berland as well.

There are n cities in Berland. People can travel between cities using two-directional train routes; there are exactly m routes, i-th route can be used to go from city viv_{i}vi​ to city uiu_{i}ui​ (and from uiu_{i}ui​ to viv_{i}vi​), and it costs wiw_{i}wi​ coins to use this route.

Each city will be visited by "Flayer", and the cost of the concert ticket in i-th city is aia_{i}ai​ coins.

You have friends in every city of Berland, and they, knowing about your programming skills, asked you to calculate the minimum possible number of coins they have to pay to visit the concert. For every city i you have to compute the minimum number of coins a person from city i has to spend to travel to some city j (or possibly stay in city i), attend a concert there, and return to city i (if j ≠ i).

Formally, for everyi∈[1,n]i\in[1, n]i∈[1,n] you have to calculatemin⁡j∈[1,n]2d(i,j)+aj\min _{j\in[1,n]} 2 d(i, j)+a_{j}minj∈[1,n]​2d(i,j)+aj​ , where d(i, j) is the minimum number of coins you have to spend to travel from city i to city j. If there is no way to reach city j from city i, then we consider d(i, j) to be infinitely large.

Input

The first line contains two integers n and m (2 ≤ n ≤ 2⋅105,1 ≤ m ≤ 2⋅1052 ≤ n ≤ 2·10^{5}, 1 ≤ m ≤ 2·10^{5}2 ≤ n ≤ 2⋅105,1 ≤ m ≤ 2⋅105).

Then m lines follow, i-th contains three integers viv_{i}vi​, uiu_{i}ui​ and wiw_{i}wi​ (1 ≤ vi, ui≤ n, vi≠ ui,1 ≤ wi ≤ 10121 ≤ v_{i}, u_{i}≤ n, v_{i}≠ u_{i}, 1 ≤ w_{i} ≤ 10^{12}1 ≤ vi​, ui​≤ n, vi​= ui​,1 ≤ wi​ ≤ 1012) denoting i-th train route. There are no multiple train routes connecting the same pair of cities, that is, for each (v, u) neither extra (v, u) nor (u, v) present in input.

The next line contains n integers a1, a2, ...ak(1 ≤ ai ≤ 1012)a_{1}, a_2, ... a_k (1 ≤ a_i ≤ 10^{12})a1​, a2​, ...ak​(1 ≤ ai​ ≤ 1012) — price to attend the concert in i-th city.

Output

Print n integers. i-th of them must be equal to the minimum number of coins a person from city i has to spend to travel to some city j (or possibly stay in city i), attend a concert there, and return to city i (if j ≠ i).

Example

Input
4 2
1 2 4
2 3 7
6 20 1 25
Output
6 14 1 25

Input
3 3
1 2 1
2 3 1
1 3 1
30 10 20
Output
12 10 12

AC Code

entry.title: 扩展欧几里得算法
entry.content:
# 扩展欧几里得算法

# 欧几里得算法 Euclidean Algorithm

# 定理

对于∀非负整数x,y\forall 非负整数x,y∀非负整数x,y，均有gcd(x,y)=gcd(y,x%y)gcd(x, y) = gcd(y, x \% y)gcd(x,y)=gcd(y,x%y)

# 证明

不防设 x>yx > yx>y. 令q=x/y,r=x%yq=x/y, r=x\%yq=x/y,r=x%y. (k 为正整数)
⇒x=qy+r,r=x−qy\Rightarrow x=qy + r, r=x-qy⇒x=qy+r,r=x−qy.
不妨设gcd(x,y)=d1,gcd(y,r)=d2gcd(x, y)=d_{1}, gcd(y, r) = d_{2}gcd(x,y)=d1​,gcd(y,r)=d2​，即需证明d_{1}=d_

  1. 由于gcd(x,y)=d1gcd(x,y)=d_{1}gcd(x,y)=d1​，则⇒d1∣x,d1∣y\Rightarrow d_{1}|x,d_{1}|y⇒d1​∣x,d1​∣y（x 可以整除 d，y 可以整除 d）
    ⇒d1∣(x−qy)⇔d1∣r\Rightarrow d_{1}|(x-qy) \Leftrightarrow d_{1}|r⇒d1​∣(x−qy)⇔d1​∣r.
    ∵d1∣y,d1∣r\because d_{1}|y, d_{1}|r∵d1​∣y,d1​∣r
    \therefore d_{2}|d_

  2. 由于gcd(y,r)=d2gcd(y,r)=d_{2}gcd(y,r)=d2​，则⇒d2∣y,d2∣r\Rightarrow d_{2}|y,d_{2}|r⇒d2​∣y,d2​∣r

    ⇒d2∣(qy+r)⇔d2∣x\Rightarrow d_{2}|(qy+r) \Leftrightarrow d_{2}|x⇒d2​∣(qy+r)⇔d2​∣x.
    ∵d2∣x,d2∣y\because d_{2}|x, d_{2}|y∵d2​∣x,d2​∣y
    ∴d1∣d2\therefore d_{1}|d_{2}∴d1​∣d2​
    固d1d_{1}d1​=d_

# 实现

#

# 裴蜀定理

# 定理

对于任意整数a、ba、ba、b 和mmm，如
ax+by=max+by=max+by=m
有整数解时，当且仅当mmm 为gcd(x，y)gcd(x，y)gcd(x，y) 的倍数
⇔a、b\Leftrightarrow a、b⇔a、b 能凑出的最小正整数为gcd(a,b)gcd(a,b)gcd(a,b)

# 证明

如果aaa 和bbb 中有一个是 0，比如a=0a=0a=0，那么它们两个的最大公约数是𝑏𝑏b。这时裴蜀等式变成𝑏𝑦=𝑚𝑏𝑦=𝑚by=m，它有整数解(𝑥,𝑦)(𝑥,𝑦)(x,y) 当且仅当mmm 是bbb 的倍数，而且有解时必然有无穷多个解，因为xxx 可以是任何整数。定理成立.
以下设a、ba、ba、b 均不为 0.

# 扩展欧几里得算法 Extended Euclidean Algorithm

# 定理

# 证明

entry.title: 二分
entry.content:
# 二分

# 题目集
